        double[][] - the data. The first dimension MUST BE 2 (double[2][whatever_int])

      • addDataSerieToHistogram

        public void addDataSerieToHistogram(String histogramID,
                           double[] dataSerie,
                           int binsCount)
        Adds data to the histogram. Given the number of bins, this will show a count on the number of times a value is repeated. For example: [1,2,3,1,1,3], and bins = 3 Will provide: _ | | _ | | _ | | _|_||_||_|_ If the number of different values is different from the number of bins, then each bin will represent the number of values in a range, evenly distributed between the minimum and the maximum value. For example: [1,2,3,1,1,3], and bins = 2 Two ranges will be considered: [1,2) and [2,3]. BE ADVISED The middle value would be assigned to the upper range. In this example, the histogram will look: _ _ | || | | || | _|_||_|_
        Parameters:
        String - - histogramID
        double[] - - dataSerie the data
        int - - the number of bins

      • setHistogramRange

        public void setHistogramRange(String histogramID,
                     int lower,
                     int upper)
        Set the histogram range to be displayed
        Parameters:
        String - - The histogram ID
